alert.note: Alert for Henry; Lee; Louisa; Van Buren; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 3:32AM CDT until April 05 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 AM CDT FOR HENRY...EAST CENTRAL VAN BUREN...SOUTHWESTERN LOUISA... SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN LEE COUNTIES... At 332 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Noble to near Mount Pleasant to near Primrose, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... New London, Winfield and Mount Union around 340 AM CDT. Columbus City and Geode State Park around 345 AM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Henry; Lee; Louisa; Van Buren; Washington
